Author: shsldepression2
Text: Thanks for the encouraging comment! We're fine now, I apologized to her. I doubt she's understood that I hate being forced to eat, but I know she does it because she's worried at least.

Author: intertropical
Text: Hey friend, it's honestly a special kind of terrifying to be coerced into eating high cal food and I'm sorry you went through all that :(   If it helps, please remember that you'll need to eat 3500kcal *over* your energy expenditure in order to gain just 1 pound of actual weight/fat. And a lot of the times, weight gain can be temporary, and due to bloating, water retention from salt/sugar/carbs, and all sorts of other factor. Also, you can't gain any actual weight when on a deficit or eating at maintenance.   Basically: if something like this happens again, you probably don't need to do as many compensatory measures as you think!!  Also, I know that EDs make things like this really difficult but now that the whole thing is over perhaps you could apologise to your mom? I'm sure she was just trying to help, but maybe you can let her know that forcing you to eat things you aren't comfortable with isn't helpful?   Sending love, good luck <3
